result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas C. Marten

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Amanda
Case Called at 2:15 pm. 
INCLUDES: 21CF911, 21CT339, 21CT340, and 22CF753. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears, and with Attorney Dylan Resch.

Date and time set for Prelim in 22CF753 and reviews in the rest of the cases. 

State notes defendant wishes to proceed with a Plea/Sentencing today. 

PRELIM: 
Waiver of Prelim filed.  
Court questions Defendant as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  R/W; R/J. 


PLEA/SENTENCING: 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  

State moves to: 
21CF911 --
Ct.2(Tampering with a Global Positioning System Tracking Device/Repeater)>>DRI.

21CT339 --
Ct.1(Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/dontr subst/refusal)>>DRI.

21CT340 --
Ct.1(Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/dontr subst/refusal)>>DRI.

22CF753 --
Ct.1(Felony BJ)>>DRI.
Ct.2(Retail Theft-Intentionally Take (<=$500))>>DRI.
Ct.3(Misd.BJ)>>DRI.
Ct.4(Misd.BJ)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
21CF911 --
Ct.1(Sex Registry Violation/Repeater)>>GUILTY.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation, to run CONCURRENT to any other sentence currently serving; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Comply with Wisconsin's Sex Offender Registration.  No driving without a valid DL.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

Adj: 2:25 pm.

ADA Cody Marschall appears in person; Atty Resch appears in person
DATES CONTINUED
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amanda.
Case Called at 9:07 am.
INCLUDES: 21CF911, 21CT339, 21CT340, 21CT340, 22CF753
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears, and with Attorney Dylan Resch. 

COURT questions Defense re: missed appearance.

State moves to vacate bond forfeiture and reinstate bond.

COURT VACATES BOND FORFEITURE. 

Next dates are set. 

Adj: 9:09 am.
